aboutPreview.title: I pack my backpack, follow the road and go...
aboutPreview.description1: Hi, I'm Alberto, and for a few years now I've discovered that my happiness weighs more or less like a backpack. I walk, travel by motorcycle, explore when I can and how I can.
aboutPreview.description2: I write this blog to capture a bit of that freedom that travel gives, to remember what I've seen and share what has stayed with me.

about.title: About me
about.description: Who I am, why I opened this diary and how to contact me.
about.heading: Hi, I'm Alberto
about.bio1: Since I set foot on my first Camino – the Portuguese coastal route to Santiago, in 2019 – I haven't stopped. It was love at first... blister. Since then, I try to give myself at least one trip every year, whether it's close to home or on the other side of the world. Just having a backpack on my shoulders and a trail ahead: that's where I'm truly happy.
about.bio2: When I'm not walking, you'll probably find me on my motorcycle, chasing mountain curves and panoramas that open up suddenly like scenes from a movie.
about.bio3: And then there's the more "wild" side of me: the one that loves to leave without a precise plan, just with a backpack, some vague ideas and a great desire to discover places, cultures and people completely different from what I'm used to. Traveling is for me a way to feel alive, curious and free.
